qas.question: How many people were left without housing?

context: The earthquake left <a4_0>at least <a0_0>5 million<a4_0/><a0_0/> people without housing, although the number could be as high as <a1_0><a5_0>1<a3_0>1 million<a5_0/><a3_0/><a1_0/>. Millions of livestock and a significant amount of agriculture were also destroyed, including <a2_0><a6_0>12.5 million<a2_0/> animals<a6_0/>, mainly birds. In the Sichuan province <a7_0>a million<a7_0/> pigs died out of 60 million total. Catastrophe modeling firm AIR Worldwide reported official estimates of insurers' losses at US$1 billion from the earthquake; estimated total damages exceed US$20 billion. It values Chengdu, at the time having an urban population of 4.5 million people, at around US$115 billion, with only a small portion covered by insurance.
